Name: Base Computer
Description:
Portable land registration service.

When placed, contacts Universal Cartographic Archive to establish ownership of land. Successful registration allows the construction of base modules across any site of the user's choosing.

Name: Landing Pad
Description: A stable, reinforced landing pad for starships.

Name: Galactic Trade Terminal
Description: A trading terminal that provides instant local access to the market for resources and commodities.

Name: Health Station
Description: A wall mounted module that can be used to recharge health.

Name: Hazard Protection Unit
Description:
A wall mounted module that can be used to recharge the user's <COMMODITY>Hazard Protection<> systems.

The Hazard Protection Unit must be kept charged with a source of <FUEL>fuel<>.

Name: Save Beacon
Description:
Once activated, beacons provide a permanent navigational waypoint, facilitating repeat visits to specific locations.

Allows user to record their progress at any time.

Name: Save Point
Description: A buildable save point for managing your progress.

Name: Signal Booster
Description:
A versatile scanner that <TECHNOLOLY>detects nearby buildings<>. Can decrypt <COMMODITY>Navigation Data<> to pinpoint specific locations.

The Signal Booster can be <VAL_ON>dismantled and redeployed<> for easy transportation.

Name: Antimatter Reactor
Description:
An <TECHNOLOGY>autonomous baryogenesis reactor<>, this device can be left to harvest reality paradoxes and convert them into usable <FUEL>antimatter<>. User must monitor fuel levels to ensure continued operation.

The resulting antimatter is safely contained, ready for use in all standard <FUEL>hyperspace power units<>.

Name: Base Teleport Module
Description:
A <TECHNOLOGY>personal teleport device<>, allowing the user to move quickly between their constructed bases, as well as any Space Station Terminuses connected to their network.

User is urged to verify network integrity before inserting any matter they cannot afford to become separated from.

Name: Fleet Command Room
Description:
Core <TECHNOLOGY>Fleet Management Station<>. This advanced holographic communications station is vital for managing fleet expeditions from the comfort of your capital ship.

User is advised that multiple stations are required to manage more than one expedition at a time.

Name: Construction Research Unit
Description:
Portable <TECHNOLOGY>blueprint research device<>.

This field-deployable research module allows the user to convert old or damaged technology modules into advanced construction blueprints.

Name: Portable Refiner
Description:
A vital piece of planetary equipment. The <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> allows gathered substances to be processed into more powerful and more advanced materials.

The Portable Refiner can be <VAL_ON>dismantled and redeployed<> for easy transportation. Note: the Portable Refiner requires <FUEL>fuel<> to operate.

Name: Medium Refiner
Description:
A vital piece of planetary equipment. The <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> allows gathered substances to be processed into more powerful and more advanced materials.

The Medium Refiner allows <COMMODITY>two<> different substances to be combined into one new material, or materials to be processed at better ratios. 

The Medium Refiner must be installed in a <VAL_ON>Habitable Base<>, but does not require additional power sources.

Name: Large Refiner
Description:
A vital piece of planetary equipment. The <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> allows gathered substances to be processed into more powerful and more advanced materials.

The Large Refiner allows <COMMODITY>three<> different substances to be combined into one new material, or materials to be processed at better ratios. 

The Large Refiner must be installed in a <VAL_ON>Habitable Base<>, but does not require additional power sources.

Name: Appearance Modifier
Description:
A buildable module that allows the users to <TECHNOLOGY>adjust their personal appearance<> settings.

The module applies advanced holographic techniques to recalibrate the light around the user, allowing them to adopt whatever appearance they desire. Visual data must be properly formated before use.

Name: Nutrient Processor
Description:
A portable <TECHNOLOGY>nutrient extractor<>, able to process and refine gathered ingredients into edible food products.

User is advised that consumption of generated products is entirely at their own risk.

Name: Automated Feeder
Description:
A robotic farming unit, designed to <STELLAR>automatically supply nearby creatures with food<>.

When powered, will attract nearby animal life. Keep bait tanks full in order to supply lifeforms with desired food.

Name: Livestock Unit
Description:
A robotic farming unit, designed to <STELLAR>automatically harvest<> substances from creatures. Requires <STELLAR>power<>.

Creatures that are ready to be harvested for milk, eggs or other specialist produce will approach the Livestock Unit and deposit their yields. The creatures are unharmed by the process.

Will harvest produce from creatures fed by hand or via an <TECHNOLOGY>Automated Feeder<>.

Name: Message Module
Description: A small and accessible information container for leaving messages or viewing left messages and short strings of information.

Name: Communications Station
Description: A terminal for the composition and transmission of messages to other travellers.

Name: Nomad Geobay
Description: An underground secure parking facility for the Nomad light Exocraft.

Name: Roamer Geobay
Description: An underground secure parking facility for the Roamer medium Exocraft.

Name: Colossus Geobay
Description: An underground secure parking facility for the Colossus large Exocraft.

Name: Pilgrim Geobay
Description: An underground secure parking facility for the Pilgrim light Exocraft.

Name: Nautilon Chamber
Description: An advanced, fully-airlocked docking station for the Nautilon submarine.

Name: Exocraft Summoning Station
Description: Construction allows the user to summon any owned Exocraft from anywhere<> else in that system. Interfaces with the Exosuit Quick Command Menu<> to ease of use. Can be compressed and carried within the Exosuit with DECONSTRUCT<> for later redeployment.

Name: Construction Terminal
Description: A research station tailored to the needs of Construction Overseers, and equipped with architectural and engineering design software.

Name: Exocraft Terminal
Description: A research station tailored to the needs of Technicians, and equipped with bespoke vehicular design software.

Name: Weapons Terminal
Description: A research station tailored to the needs of Armourers, and equipped for the development of munitions and explosives as well as selected civilian tech.

Name: Science Terminal
Description: A research station tailored to the needs of Scientists, and equipped for research and development of scientific blueprints.

Name: Agricultural Terminal
Description: A research station tailored to the needs of Farmers, and equipped for the analysis and cultivation of farmable crops.

Name: Hydroponic Tray
Description:
A self contained growth system for the indoor cultivation of agricultural crops.

Build requirement: Must be placed indoors.

Name: Large Hydroponic Tray
Description:
A self contained growth system for the indoor cultivation of agricultural crops. Can support up to four plants.

Build requirement: Must be placed indoors.

Name: Race Force Amplifier
Description: Provides a boost to your Exocraft during races.

Name: Race Obstacle
Description: Provides extra challenge for Exocraft races.

Name: Race Initiator
Description: This platform acts as the start and finish line for Exocraft field tests, allowing Travellers to practice manoeuvring and speed.

Name: Marine Shelter
Description:
An emergency survival module.

Can be rapidly deployed on the seabed in the event of an oxygen or other Exosuit life support emergency. Provides temporary shelter from environmental hazards, predators and other hostiles forces found in the deep ocean.

Name: Sphere Creator
Description:
A highly-specific fabrication device, developed with the intention of finding the universe's most perfect sphere.

Requires <STELLAR>power<> to operate. Will create a large sphere, ready for whatever experiments are deemed necessary.

Name: Noise Box
Description:
A special construction module designed to emit a high-frequency noise. Pitch may be adjusted to the user's requirements.

Requires <STELLAR>power<> to operate.

Name: Oxygen Harvester
Description:
An <TECHNOLOGY>autonomous atmosphere extractor<>, this device can be left to collect and purify oxygen from the air. User must monitor fuel levels to ensure continued operation.

The resulting gas is compressed and processed, ready for use in all standard <FUEL>life support systems<>.

Name: Autonomous Mining Unit
Description: An automated harvester for the mining of resources. Once activated, the AMU extracts minerals without the need for supervision, providing a regular yield until the site is exhausted.

Name: Mineral Extractor
Description:
An automated mineral harvester. Determine a site with the <TECHNOLOGY>Surveying<> upgrade for the <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>. Mineral extraction rates and produced minerals will vary from site to site.

Requires <STELLAR>power<> to function. Connect to <TECHNOLOGY>Silos<> with <TECHNOLOGY>Pipelines<> to allow collection from more convenient sites.

Name: Gas Extractor
Description:
An automated gas harvester. Determine a site with the <TECHNOLOGY>Surveying<> upgrade for the <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>. Gas extraction rates and produced gases will vary from site to site.

Requires <STELLAR>power<> to function. Connect to <TECHNOLOGY>Silos<> with <TECHNOLOGY>Pipelines<> to allow collection from more convenient sites.

Name: Supply Depot
Description:
Automated storage unit. Connect to a <TRADEABLE>Supply Grid<> using <TECHNOLOGY>Pipelines<>.

Automatically stores the output of various <STELLAR>Mineral<> and <STELLAR>Gas Extractors<>, allowing for increased capacity and more efficient siting. Can be located a long distances from the extraction site.

Name: Supply Pipe
Description:
Flexible, high-strength piping. Able to withstand a highly-pressurised internal environment.

Used for connecting various <STELLAR>Mineral<> and <STELLAR>Gas Extractors<> to <TECHNOLOGY>Silos<>

Name: Solar Panel
Description:
An efficient <STELLAR>power generator<>, this solar array will turn sunlight into the electrical energy required to power many base structures.

Generates <FUEL>no power at night<>. Partner with <TECHNOLOGY>Batteries<> to store energy for the hours of darkness.

Name: Electromagnetic Generator
Description:
When suitably placed in an area of high field strength, efficient electromagnetic dynamos are used to generate <STELLAR>near limitless power<>.

Locate appropriate sites with the <TECHNOLOGY>Surveying<> upgrade for the <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>. Power output will vary from site to site.

Name: Biofuel Reactor
Description:
A small <STELLAR>power generator<>. Burns carbon-based fuel placed in its <TECHNOLOGY>furnace tank<> and converts it into usable power.

Connect power generators to base structures and technologies with <TECHNOLOGY>electrical wiring<>. Many parts require power to function.

Name: Electrical Wiring
Description:
High-capacity electrical wiring. Use wiring to connect <TECHNOLOGY>Power Generators<> to your base. Most technology, as well as structures with embedded lighting systems, require a power source to operate.

Wiring can be connected to <TECHNOLOGY>various switches<> to facilitate selective power flow.

Name: Teleport Cable
Description: Advanced fibre-optic cabling, designed to link one or more <TECHNOLOGY>Short-Range Teleporters<>.

Name: Wall Switch
Description:
A <STELLAR>power management device<>, the switch will toggle the flow of power when pulled.

Switches require both power and signal wires to control a device.

Name: Floor Switch
Description:
A <STELLAR>power management device<>, the switch will toggle the flow of power when stood upon or otherwise activated.

Switches require both power and signal wires to control a device.

Name: Battery
Description:
Highly-efficient <TECHNOLOGY>energy storage units<>. Connect to a power grid, and onboard power management circuits will <STELLAR>automatically draw down spare capacity<> to charge its cells.

When the grid attempts to draw more power than is currently supplied, the battery will <STELLAR>automatically deploy power<> to make up the shortfall.

Name: Proximity Switch
Description:
A <STELLAR>power management device<>, the switch will toggle the flow of power when an entity is detected nearby.

Switches require both power and signal wires to control a device.

Name: Button
Description:
A <STELLAR>power management device<>, the switch will toggle the flow of power when used.

Switches require both power and signal wires to control a device.

Name: Power Inverter
Description:
A <STELLAR>power management device<>, the switch will toggle the flow of power when used.

Switches require both power and signal wires to control a device.

Name: Auto Switch
Description:
A <STELLAR>power management device<>, this switch will toggle the flow of power when signaled by an incoming signal.

Switches require both power and signal wires to control a device.

Name: Short-Range Teleporter
Description:
A low-powered teleporter, construction for instantaneous travel across short distances.

When <STELLAR>wired<> to both a power source and another short-range teleporter, allows near-instant travel between nearby locations.

Name: Minotaur Geobay
Description:
An secure parking, summoning and customisation facility for the <STELLAR>Minotaur Heavy Exosuit Hybrid<>.

Deploy the Minotaur from the Quick Menu. With the aid of an <TECHNOLOGY>Orbital Exocraft Materialiser<> mounted inside a freighter, the Minotaur can be instantly deployed to any location within the same system as the mothership.

Name: Multi-Tool Expansion Slot
Description:
A flexible upgrade circuit, compatible with all <STELLAR>person Multi-Tools<>.

This module can be wired into a Multi-Tool at a Space Station <STELLAR>Multi-Tool Upgrade Rack<>, granting the user more space in the Multi-Tool's internal layout to add further upgrades or technology specialisations.

Name: Storage Container
Description: Spacious additional storage for inventory items.

Name: Storage Container
Description: Spacious additional storage for inventory items.

Name: Storage Container
Description: Spacious additional storage for inventory items.

Name: Storage Container
Description: Spacious additional storage for inventory items.

Name: Storage Container
Description: Spacious additional storage for inventory items.

Name: Storage Container
Description: Spacious additional storage for inventory items.

Name: Storage Container
Description: Spacious additional storage for inventory items.

Name: Storage Container
Description: Spacious additional storage for inventory items.

Name: Storage Container
Description: Spacious additional storage for inventory items.

Name: Storage Container
Description: Spacious additional storage for inventory items.

Name: Freighter Storage Unit
Description:
Hybrid high-capacity storage unit / shelving module for installation in interstellar freighters.

Compatible with all standard life-support fittings.

Name: Freighter Storage Unit
Description:
Hybrid high-capacity storage unit / shelving module for installation in interstellar freighters.

Compatible with all standard life-support fittings.

Name: Freighter Storage Unit
Description:
Hybrid high-capacity storage unit / shelving module for installation in interstellar freighters.

Compatible with all standard life-support fittings.

Name: Freighter Storage Unit
Description:
Hybrid high-capacity storage unit / shelving module for installation in interstellar freighters.

Compatible with all standard life-support fittings.

Name: Freighter Storage Unit
Description:
Hybrid high-capacity storage unit / shelving module for installation in interstellar freighters.

Compatible with all standard life-support fittings.

Name: Freighter Storage Unit
Description:
Hybrid high-capacity storage unit / shelving module for installation in interstellar freighters.

Compatible with all standard life-support fittings.

Name: Freighter Storage Unit
Description:
Hybrid high-capacity storage unit / shelving module for installation in interstellar freighters.

Compatible with all standard life-support fittings.

Name: Freighter Storage Unit
Description:
Hybrid high-capacity storage unit / shelving module for installation in interstellar freighters.

Compatible with all standard life-support fittings.

Name: Freighter Storage Unit
Description:
Hybrid high-capacity storage unit / shelving module for installation in interstellar freighters.

Compatible with all standard life-support fittings.

Name: Freighter Storage Unit
Description:
Hybrid high-capacity storage unit / shelving module for installation in interstellar freighters.

Compatible with all standard life-support fittings.

Name: Atmosphere Harvester
Description: An automated siphon unit for the collection of valuable gases. Once activated, the harvester condenses and compresses substances from the air over time. Compressed gas is then stored safely until collected.

Name: ByteBeat Device
Description:
An advanced audio generator, allowing the user to <TECHNOLOGY>synthesise complex musical arrangements<>.

Multiple devices may be placed in sequence or connected to <STELLAR>lights<> to generate spectacular displays.

Name: ByteBeat Cable
Description:
Advanced cabling, designed to link one or more <TECHNOLOGY>Bytebeat Generators<> or to connect a <TECHNOLOGY>Bytebeat Switch<> to the network.

The signal will synchronize connected lights and device to the generated waveform.

Name: Bytebeat Switch
Description: A musical switching device, designed to interpret waveform signals generated by a <TECHNOLOGY>Bytebeat Generator<> and output electrical impulses to connected <TECHNOLOGY>lights<> and other devices.

Name: Electrical Cloaking Unit
Description:
Device to enable a wireless aesthetic in habitable bases.

Constructing the <TECHNOLOGY>Electrical Cloaking Unit<> within a powered base will reduce the visual prominence of all local <TECHNOLOGY>Electrical Wiring<>. Hidden wires will continue to supply electricity, provided they are sufficiently powered.

Name: Salvaged Data
Description:
The salvageable heart of some ancient technology. Unreadable in its current form.

These databanks can be spent at a <TECHNOLOGY>Construction Research Unit<> and used to research new <STELLAR>Construction Blueprints<>.

Name: AtlasPass v1
Description:
Security and permissions pass granted to specific travellers by many primary galactic species.

Provides access to low level restricted areas and outpost systems.

Name: AtlasPass v2
Description:
Security and permissions pass granted to specific travellers by many primary galactic species.
 
Provides access to mid-tier restricted areas and outpost systems.

Name: AtlasPass v3
Description:
Security and permissions pass granted to specific travellers by many primary galactic species.
 
Provides access to high level restricted areas and outpost systems.

Name: Factory Override Unit
Description:
A portable data unit, compatible with most <STELLAR>planetary fabricator facilities<>.

Once access has been gained to a central control terminal, the Override Unit can divert the facilities resources towards researching new product recipes.

Name: Salvaged Frigate Module
Description:
A technology module harvested from the remains of a large interstellar starship. May be collected from <STELLAR>freighter crashsites<> or salvaged during <STELLAR>frigate expeditions<>.

Useless in its current form, a <TECHNOLOGY>Research Station<> aboard your freighter may be able to convert it into useable technology.

Name: Cargo Bulkhead
Description:
A technology module harvested from the remains of an <STELLAR>abandoned freighter<> found floating in space. May also be salvaged during <STELLAR>frigate expeditions<>.

Pre-packed nano-expanders fill out this portable unit and graft it to an existing freighter, increasing its <STELLAR>inventory capacity<>. Apply at your freighter's <TECHNOLOGY>Upgrade Terminal<>.

Name: Spawning Sac
Description: An additional storage nodule<> for Sentient<> starships. Upon hatching, the parasite inside this sac is grafted upon the vessel, exchanging the use of its cavernous innards for vital nutrients from the host. Use FE_ALT1<><> to trigger growth and begin the hatching process<>.

Name: Psychonic Egg
Description: A writhing sac of genetic fluid, designed to foster the creation of new bio-infused technology<> for a sentient starship<>. The embryo will grow into bio-technology upgrade<>. Begin biogenesis<> with FE_ALT1<><>.

Name: Storage Augmentation
Description:
A technology module harvested from the remains of a <STELLAR>salvaged starship<>. May also be collected from <STELLAR>freighter crash sites<> or salvaged during <STELLAR>frigate expeditions<>.

Can be used to expand starship storage capacity at the Space Station's <TECHNOLOGY>Starship Outfitter<>.

Name: Navigation Data
Description:
Encoded navigation data. This highly portable data unit contains all relevant cartographical information for a planetary region.

May be traded with a <TRADEABLE>Cartographer<> aboard a Space Station in exchange for <STELLAR>usable star charts<>.

Name: Exosuit Upgrade Chart
Description: Encoded navigation data which, when properly decrypted, will reveal the location of a Drop Pod<> containing an Exosuit Inventory Upgrade<>. Select the coordinates in the inventory and use Plot Route<> (FE_ALT1<>) to pin the location in your Exosuit display.
ConsumableRewardTexts: Convert data to Exosuit navigation marker

Name: Log Encryption Key
Description:
A fragment of the encryption override sequence for a <TECHNOLOGY>freighter's emergency log<>.

Several parts of the sequence may be required to gain full access to recorded data.

Name: Defence Chit
Description: A token, entitling the bearer to support from the system authorities in dealing with pirate attacks.

Name: Memory Fragment
Description: The shattered remnants of an expired traveller<>. It whispers, an unknowable name deep within its fibres. The memory will manifest as an important technology upgrade<> to aid you on your travels. Absorb<> this memory with FE_ALT1<><>.
ConsumableRewardTexts: Ingest item via suit nutrient system

Name: Memory Fragment (Inventory)
Description: The shattered remnants of an expired traveller<>. It whispers, an unknowable name deep within its fibres. The memory will manifest as an inventory expansion<> to aid you on your travels. Absorb<> this memory with FE_ALT1<><>.
ConsumableRewardTexts: Ingest item via suit nutrient system

Name: Archived Technology Package
Description: An archived wiring package<>, designed to allow easy storage of core technology. Use FE_ALT1<><> to begin the installation process<>. %TECH_DESC%

Name: Genetic Repository
Description: A cryogenically frozen node, designed to facilitate the archival of bio-technology<> for sentient starships<>. Use FE_ALT1<><> to begin the installation process<>. %TECH_DESC%
